2000.context: Netflix, Inc. is a streaming entertainment service focused on subscription video streaming and original content production. DVD-by-mail rental. Offered to sell to Blockbuster.

competitors.name: Blockbuster
competitors.notes: Dominant video rental chain with 9,000+ stores, rejected Netflix acquisition offer

competitors.name: Hollywood Video
competitors.notes: Second largest video rental chain in US

competitors.name: Movie Gallery
competitors.notes: Video rental chain focused on rural markets

competitors.name: Amazon
competitors.notes: DVD sales online, potential threat to Netflix model

competitors.name: Walmart
competitors.notes: DVD sales and emerging video rental services

competitors.name: Traditional video stores
competitors.notes: Local mom-and-pop rental shops

2005.context: Netflix, Inc. is a streaming entertainment service focused on subscription video streaming and original content production. DVD leadership. Streaming technology development.

competitors.name: Blockbuster Online
competitors.notes: Launched 2004, claimed 1M online customers by Aug 2005

competitors.name: Redbox
competitors.notes: DVD kiosk rental, established 2002 at McDonald's locations

competitors.name: Hollywood Video
competitors.notes: Second largest video rental chain

competitors.name: Amazon
competitors.notes: DVD sales, put fear into Netflix executive team

competitors.name: Walmart
competitors.notes: Exited DVD rental in 2005, cross-promotional deal with Netflix

competitors.name: GameFly
competitors.notes: Video game rental by mail service

2010.context: Netflix, Inc. is a streaming entertainment service focused on subscription video streaming and original content production. Streaming pivot. International expansion beginning.

competitors.name: Blockbuster
competitors.notes: Video rental chain struggling to compete (bankrupt 2010)

competitors.name: Redbox
competitors.notes: DVD rental kiosks at retail locations

competitors.name: Hulu
competitors.notes: Streaming service from NBC, Fox, and Disney

competitors.name: Amazon Prime Video
competitors.notes: Amazon's streaming service launched 2006

competitors.name: Cable TV
competitors.notes: Traditional pay TV from Comcast, Time Warner

competitors.name: HBO
competitors.notes: Premium cable channel with original content

competitors.name: iTunes
competitors.notes: Apple's video purchase and rental service

competitors.name: Vudu
competitors.notes: Digital video purchase and rental

2015.context: Netflix, Inc. is a streaming entertainment service focused on subscription video streaming and original content production. Original content success. House of Cards, Orange is New Black.

competitors.name: Amazon Prime Video
competitors.notes: Bundled with Prime shipping

competitors.name: Hulu
competitors.notes: Network-owned streaming service

competitors.name: HBO Now
competitors.notes: HBO's standalone streaming

competitors.name: YouTube
competitors.notes: Free video platform

competitors.name: Cable/Satellite TV
competitors.notes: Traditional pay TV declining

competitors.name: Apple
competitors.notes: iTunes video, Apple TV box

competitors.name: Showtime
competitors.notes: Premium cable streaming

competitors.name: Vudu
competitors.notes: Walmart's video service

2020.context: Netflix, Inc. is a streaming entertainment service focused on subscription video streaming and original content production. Pandemic streaming surge. 200M+ subscribers reached.

competitors.name: Disney+
competitors.notes: Disney's streaming service launched Nov 2019, 87M subs by end of 2020

competitors.name: Amazon Prime Video
competitors.notes: Bundled with Prime, investing in originals

competitors.name: HBO Max
competitors.notes: WarnerMedia streaming with HBO content library

competitors.name: Hulu
competitors.notes: Disney-controlled streaming with next-day TV

competitors.name: Apple TV+
competitors.notes: Apple's streaming with original content

competitors.name: Peacock
competitors.notes: NBCUniversal streaming service launched 2020

competitors.name: YouTube
competitors.notes: Free video competing for viewing time

competitors.name: TikTok
competitors.notes: Short-form video capturing younger audiences

2024.context: Netflix, Inc. is a streaming entertainment service focused on subscription video streaming and original content production. Ad tier and password sharing crackdown drove growth.

competitors.name: Disney+
competitors.notes: Disney streaming with Hulu bundle, reached profitability

competitors.name: Amazon Prime Video
competitors.notes: Streaming included with Prime, adding live sports

competitors.name: Max (HBO)
competitors.notes: Warner Bros Discovery streaming with HBO content

competitors.name: Apple TV+
competitors.notes: Premium originals and live sports (MLS)

competitors.name: YouTube
competitors.notes: Largest video platform, YouTube TV for live

competitors.name: Peacock
competitors.notes: NBCUniversal streaming with Olympics and sports

competitors.name: Paramount+
competitors.notes: Paramount Global streaming service

competitors.name: TikTok
competitors.notes: Short-form video competing for attention

2025.context: Netflix, Inc. is a streaming entertainment service focused on subscription video streaming and original content production. Streaming leader with live events. Competing with Disney+, Amazon.

competitors.name: Disney+
competitors.notes: Disney streaming with ESPN integration plans

competitors.name: Amazon Prime Video
competitors.notes: Streaming with Thursday Night Football and MGM content

competitors.name: YouTube
competitors.notes: Largest video platform competing for viewing time

competitors.name: Max
competitors.notes: Warner Bros Discovery streaming with HBO originals

competitors.name: Apple TV+
competitors.notes: Premium originals and sports rights

competitors.name: Peacock
competitors.notes: NBCU streaming with sports and Olympics

competitors.name: TikTok
competitors.notes: Short-form video capturing younger demographics

competitors.name: Tubi
competitors.notes: Free ad-supported streaming growing rapidly
